Dictionary.Name: The Collaborative International Dictionary of English v.0.44

Definition.WordDefinition:
Huffy \Huff"y\, a. 1. Puffed up; as, huffy bread. [1913 Webster]
2. Characterized by arrogance or petulance; easily offended. [1913 Webster]

huffy adj 1: quick to take offense [syn: {thin-skinned}, {touchy}] 2: roused to anger; "stayed huffy a good while"- Mark Twain; "she gets mad when you wake her up so early"; "mad at his friend"; "sore over a remark" [syn: {mad}, {sore}]
